website_summaries.verdict: The Pixelbook has high-end hardware and a great hybrid design, but it’s still hard to justify spending so much on a Chrome OS laptop.
pros: The Google Pixelbook has a sleek convertible design
Its sharp touchscreen is bright and colorful
Performance is fast, lag-free and smooth
The dedicated Google Assistant button is useful
cons: It has the same built-in limitations as other Chrome OS systems

customer_reviews.title: Can't use Adobe Photoshop or Adobe DC with it.
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this computer until I realized that there are programs you cannot use on it, even though it costs almost as much as a mac book!! I thought it was the ultimate solution to a computer and chromebook in one...but to my dismay, I cannot put it in "computer" mode :(
customer_reviews.author: FitAussieKylie

customer_reviews.title: As good as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews prior to purchasing as I did not have access to a physical Pixelbook to check it out myself. After several weeks of use I am very happy with the purchase. The negative reviews I had seen turned out to be irrelevant to me and the reality is that I use it happily every day. The 'large' bezel, ''poor' Android integration and 'limited' functionality of Chrome OS are not issues for me and seem to be have exaggerated by some reviewers.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Palmer

customer_reviews.title: The pixelbook itself works fine, but the charging cable was broken when it arrived
customer_reviews.text: While setting up my Pixelbook, I tried to charge it (as the instruction says) with the power adapter and type-c cable came with the box. Then I found it wasn't charged. The charging LED was not illuminated and the battery icon didn't change. After few trials, I realized the charging cable was broken already. (I used my own type-c cable, then it works.) I checked the dysfunctional cable. It looked different from the type-c cable I already have (for my Pixel phone). A USB type-C supposes to have 24 pins, however the one I get was missing lots of pins (on both sides). It's really difficult to understand how could this happen to a new product. Kind of disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: WY

customer_reviews.title: Was happy until it died
customer_reviews.text: Was happy with the pixelbook. Nice looks. Good touchscreen. Very quick. Decent battery. Seemed like a solid build. After a year, things started to malfunction. When the device would go to sleep it would take multiple attempts to turn it back on. Got to the point I turned off sleep mode, and stopped having the issue. I recently was having trouble with apps crashing, so I figured I would reboot. I turned off the device and now it won't turn back on. Brought the device to a recommended repair place and they say they can't fix it, likely a motherboard issue. Less than 2 years and the device is a brick. Too expensive for that to happen.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually picky with laptops but this is very MINIMAL and flat/easy to use. Flips back as a tablet, touch screen and easy interface unlike Apple or Microsoft. I'm always on google so this works out perfectly!!! My only issue is that is doesn't have a CD, usb attachment for USB drives and battery tends to over heat. But the processor is fast and my desktop and apps are never cluttered.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: The Pixelbook is worth the price. You feel it's worth in every aspect. It fits everyone of my needs minus heavy Photoshop. It even replaces my Pixel 2 when I'm sitting down. The soft touch silicone accents are great palm rests and really add to the premium feel. The instant tether between the Pixelbook and Pixel 2 works great. I do not have anything negative to say about it.
